item.title: First Node projects
item.description: I’ve just completed the first two microserver node-based projects in the backend section of FreeCodeCamp. Woohoo! Time stamp microserver Check out the first one here. When someone updates the url with either a unix time or a natural date (in the month day, year format) it returns the result in json as follows: { "unix": 1412985600000, "natural": "October 11, 2014" } I started by just trying to get the server to return the string from the url.

item.title: LearnYouNode
item.description: I’ve spent the last week working through the node.js section of FreeCodeCamp…. Boy, am I confused. I don’t have a computer background and didn’t tinker with the things as a kid, so I didn’t really have a clue what a server was until last weekend! Now I have a slightly better idea. Slightly. I’d never really thougth about how a website works or what’s happening when you type a url…you just kinda saw a web page…that was it.

item.title: Hello World
item.description: title I started learning to code in spring 2016. Well, I say I started then, but I’d kinda dabbled before doing a little bit of python and html/css but never anything particularly serious or in-depth. What prompted me to start? Well, I’d been thinking I needed a change of career for some time, middle-management in an industry that didn’t inspire me didn’t feel like a great way to spend eight hours a day.
